item.title: Recognition for a community of volunteers
item.description: Do you know a community hero who dedicates their own time and skills on behalf of others? Well, we want to hear about them.

item.description: Work is already underway to deal with the effects of Storm Goretti after the district’s coastline faced strong and forceful winds overnight.

item.description: A bundle of thoughtful gifts will be shared to vulnerable children and young people in the district on Christmas Day thanks to a council initiative.

item.description: A fresh cohort of students are helping shape the district’s future after joining the council’s youth forum.

item.title: Lower Leas Coastal Park project moving forward
item.description: Some of the existing play equipment at the Lower Leas Coastal Park will be removed ahead of the fun zone’s highly anticipated refurbishment in 2026.

item.title: Folkestone - A Brighter Future updates
item.description: The Folkestone – A Brighter Future scheme is more than a third complete with works planned to finish in Summer 2026.

item.title: Backing volunteers with right support
item.description: Folkestone & Hythe District Council has reaffirmed its commitment to local volunteers and community groups supporting residents.

item.title: Councils send proposals for new councils to ministers
item.description: Proposals for the preferred number of new councils needed for Kent and Medway, and the geographical areas they should cover, have been submitted to the government today (Friday 28 November).

item.title: Talking about what matters to you
item.description: Suggestions for topics to be discussed by Folkestone & Hythe District Council’s overview and scrutiny committee in 2026/27 are now being welcomed.

item.description: A free magazine celebrating the wonderful aspects of Folkestone & Hythe is to make its way through letterboxes from this week.

item.title: Three unitary option backed by Folkestone & Hythe
item.description: Local Government Reorganisation (LGR) in east Kent should be delivered by joining together the council areas covered by Folkestone & Hythe with those of Dover, Thanet, Ashford and Canterbury.

item.description: A blueprint for a net zero district by 2041 has been unanimously backed by cabinet members.

item.description: Good progress continues to be made on schemes delivering 70 new affordable, green homes in the district.

item.title: Whole load of heavy lifting for district's coastline
item.description: Around 100,000 tonnes of shingle – the equivalent to 1,250 blue whales or 33,000 cars – will be recycled and regraded in the latest phase of beach management work.

item.title: Councils reveal draft business cases for new councils
item.description: Councils from across Kent and Medway have published a series of draft business cases to help inform the next steps in the government’s biggest shake up of local councils in 50 years.

item.description: The Edwardian section of the Folca building in Folkestone has gone on the market.

item.title: How to Get Involved in Folkestone’s Future (Even if You’re Busy)
item.description: We all want to live in a town that feels welcoming, inspiring, and cared for. But for many of us, the thought of “getting involved” feels daunting. item.title: Why Local History Still Matters in a Modern Town
item.description: We live in a fast-paced world. Towns change, skylines shift, and new businesses come and go. It can be tempting to think heritage is something we leave in museums or history books. But in reality, local history is what gives a place its character – and without it, we risk losing not only our i…

item.title: Small Acts, Big Change: How Community Projects Shape a Town

item.title: Developed my first film!
item.description: Always wanted to do that but the cost of buying all the quipment put me off. With Folkeshare I can hire the bits I need at very low cost and don’t have to store more stuff. They include everything needed apart from the chemistry. For that we have 2 camera shops near by.
